item.title: GameStop's Struggles Continue
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

GameStop has released its latest earnings report, shining a light on how the video game retailer is performing in the market--and it was a mixed quarter for the company.

Revenue came in at $821 million, compared to $860.3 million during the same period last year, and short of Wall Street projections. Profit, however, soared from $17.4 million last year to $77.1 million for the latest period. GameStop's stock price sank after the earnings report came out, with many saying the revenue miss was to blame for the falling price.

Others, however, have said GameStop's strong profit-growth, along with having more than $8.8 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities (up from $4.6 billion last year) is a sign of health. Additionally, GameStop's Selling, General, and Administrative (SG&A) costs were $221.4 million for the quarter, down from $282 million during the same period last year.

GameStop achieved the lower SG&A costs through a variety of means, including store closures and layoffs. GameStop closed 590 stores in the US in fiscal 2024 and the company said, "We anticipate closing a significant number of additional stores in fiscal 2025."

GameStop made the majority of its money for the quarter that ended on November 1 from hardware and accessories, reaching $367.4 million (down from $417.4 million). Software sales came in at $197.5 million (down from $271.8 million), while revenue from collectibles landed at $256.1 million (up from $171.1 million).

What's more, GameStop's Bitcoin holdings finished the quarter at $519.4 million. GameStop bought more than $510 million worth of Bitcoin in May 2025, so the value has appreciated, but not by much. Bitcoin is highly volatile, after all. Bitcoin's value crashed from its all-time high price of more than $126,000 back in October 2025. Today, Bitcoin is trading at around $92,100.

GameStop was also in the news recently for its Trade Anything Day, where people could bring almost anything to a store to trade in for $5. People brought dead animals and a tiny Jesus.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley - All Winter Warmth Star Path Duties And How To Complete Them
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After its recent paid expansion, Wishblossom Ranch, Disney Dreamlight Valley is back with another free update for all players to enjoy. This time around, you can finally invite beloved Disney princess Cinderella to your valley and go through her questline to form a new friendship. However, as expected, there's also a fresh Star Path for you to tackle. The Winter Warmth Star Path includes plenty of winter-themed cosmetics, furniture, and more, giving you plenty of fun stuff to decorate your valley with this holiday season.

If you're struggling to figure out how to complete any of the Star Path duties, we've got all of them listed below alongside how to solve them.

All Winter Warmth Star Path duties and how to complete them

  • Buy seeds somewhere frosty - Buy seeds in the Frosted Heights
  • Buy vegetable seeds fit for a ball - Buy Pumpkin seeds
  • Cast around for seafood - Catch any seafood
  • Catch fish in gold ripples - Catch any legendary fish
  • Catch fish somewhere dazzling - Catch fish in Dazzling Beach
  • Catch fish somewhere peaceful - Catch fish in the Peaceful Meadow
  • Collect some shoreline shellfish - Pick up Mussels, Clams, or Oysters
  • Complete Boutique Challenges - Complete any of Daisy's challenges
  • Cook a fairly fancy appetizer - Cook any 4-star appetizer
  • Cook a fairly fancy dessert - Cook any 4-star dessert
  • Cook a fairly fancy dinner - Cook any 4-star entrees
  • Cook a perfect appetizer - Cook any 5-star appetizer
  • Cook a perfect dessert - Cook any 5-star dessert
  • Cook any 2-star meal - Cook any 2-star entree
  • Craft Bricks - Craft Bricks
  • Craft a potion to boost your garden - Craft Miracle Growth Elixir or Even More Miraculous Growth Elixir
  • Craft a potion to help you go fish - Craft Miraculous Fishing Bait or Even More Miraculous Fishing Bait
  • Craft a potion to polish your Royal Pickaxe - Craft Miraculous Pickaxe Varnish or Even More Miraculous Pickaxe Varnish
  • Craft a potion you can really "dig" - Craft Miraculous Shovel Varnish or Even More Miraculous Shovel Varnish
  • Craft any Training Manual - Craft any of the Training Manuals
  • Craft any refinement item - Craft any refinement item
  • Craft anything - Craft any items
  • Craft some Gold Ingots - Craft Gold Ingots
  • Dig anywhere in the Valley - Dig in any biome
  • Dig for special crystals underground - Mine for Vitalys Crystals in the Vitalys Mines
  • Earn 30,000 Star Coins - Collect 30,000 Star Coins
  • Earn 5,000 Dreamlight - Collect 5,000 Dreamlight
  • Earn 7,500 Dreamlight - Collect 7,500 Dreamlight
  • Equip a level 2 critter companion - Equip any level 2 companion
  • Feed the Raccoon critters their favourite food - Give blueberries to Raccoons
  • Find Memories - Collect Memory Orbs
  • Fish somewhere forgotten - Catch fish in the Forgotten Lands
  • Fish somewhere frosty - Catch fish in Frosted Heights
  • Fish somewhere that's always sunlit - Catch fish in Sunlit Plateau
  • Fish somewhere trustworthy - Catch fish in the Glade of Trust
  • Fish somewhere valorous - Catch fish in the Forest of Valor
  • Gain 15,000 Star Coins - Collect 15,000 Star Coins
  • Get crafty! - Craft any items
  • Give Cinderella her favourite gift - Give a favorite gift to Cinderella
  • Give residents of Halloween Town their favorite gifts - Give favorite gifts to Jack or Sally
  • Give the Sea Turtle their favourite food - Give Seaweed to Sea Turtles
  • Give the monsters their favorite gifts - Give favorite gifts to Mike or Sully
  • Go fish! - Catch any fish
  • Hang out with Cinderella - Spend time hanging out with Cinderella
  • Hang out with Donald - Spend time hanging out with Donald
  • Hang out with Goofy - Spend time hanging out with Goofy
  • Hang out with Merlin - Spend time hanging out with Merlin
  • Hang out with Mickey - Spend time hanging out with Mickey
  • Hang out with Minnie - Spend time hanging out with Minnie
  • Harvest Olaf's nose - Harvest Carrots
  • Harvest a key chocolate Ingredient - Harvest Cocoa Beans
  • Harvest different fruits - Harvest any fruits
  • Harvest some red bush berries - Harvest Raspberries
  • Harvest vegetables that might take you to the ball - Harvest Pumpkins
  • Have a daily discussion with Cinderella - Have a daily discussion with Cinderella
  • Have a daily discussion with any villager - Have a daily discussion with any villager
  • Mine for blue gems - Mine for Aquamarine, Sapphire, Blue Zircon, Pure Ice, or Star Sapphire
  • Mine for green gems - Mine for Emerald, Peridot, or Jade
  • Mine for green or orange gems - Mine for Emeralds, Peridots, Jade, or Citrine
  • Mine for oval gems - Mine for Aquamarine, Citrine, Garnet, Peridot, Tourmaline, or Blue Zircon
  • Mine for purple gems - Mine for Amethyst or Alexandrite
  • Mine for purple or yellow gems - Amethyst, Alexandrite, Citrine, or Topaz
  • Mine for red gems - Mine for Garnet, Ruby, or Spinel
  • Mine for something shiny - Mine for any shiny gems
  • Mine for square gems - Mine for Amethyst, Emerald, Ruby, Sapphire, Spinel, or Topaz
  • Mine for white gems - Mine for Diamond or Opal
  • Mine for yellow gems - Mine for Citrine or Topaz
  • Mine precious gems with a Royal Tool - Mine for any gems
  • Open up fresh Memories - Collect Memory Orbs
  • Pet your animal companion - Pet your companion
  • Pet your critter companion - Pet your companion
  • Pick blue flowers - Harvest any blue flowers
  • Plant vegetables that make great coaches - Plant Pumpkins
  • Practice MINE-fulness - Mine any nodes
  • Prepare Poached Basil-Butter Sturgeon - Cook Poached Basil-Butter Sturgeon
  • Sell fruit - Sell any fruits
  • Sell gems - Sell any gems
  • Sell items - Sell any items
  • Sell snowman building material - Sell Snowballs, Carrots, or Pebbles
  • Sell some orange vegetables that might take you to the ball - Sell Pumpkins
  • Serve customers at Tiana's Palace - Serve meals at Tiana's Palace
  • Serve customers in Chez Remy - Serve meals at Chez Remy
  • Spend time with a villager - Spend time hanging out with any villager
  • Tackle Royal Tasks - Complete Dreamlight Duties
  • Take a picture of Scrooge's Shop - Take a photo of Scrooge's Shop in any biome
  • Take a picture with Cinderella - Take a photo with Cinderella
  • Talk to a mermaid, sea witch, or sailing prince - Talk to Ariel, Ursula, or Prince Eric
  • Talk to a warrior or her guardian dragon - Have a daily discussion with Mulan or Mushu
  • Uproot Night Thorns - Remove Night Thorns
  • Whip up Spicy Baked Bream - Cook Spicy Baked Bream
  • Whip up a 1-star meal - Cook a 1-star entree

For more on Disney Dreamlight Valley, check out our guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Viture Reveals High-Tech Cyberpunk 2077 Limited-Edition XR Glasses
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Cyberpunk 2077 fans can now own a piece of tech that feels and looks like something you'd find at Kiroshi Opticals in Night City. To celebrate the game's fifth anniversary, CD Projekt Red partnered with Viture on limited-edition XR glasses themed around Cyberpunk 2077. The Viture x Cyberpunk 2077 5th Anniversary Collector's Edition XR Glasses are numbered to 10,000 and available to purchase now for $549 on Viture's online storefront and at select major retailers.

Viture Luma Cyber XR Glasses combine the form factor of the Luma Pro ($499) with the technical enhancements found in the Luma Ultra ($599). Officially licensed collectible editions of tech and gaming products usually cost more than standard models, so it's pretty cool that the Luma Cyber XR Glasses cost $50 less than the Luma Ultra.

Designed by CD Projekt Red artists, the Luma Cyber XR Glasses feature the Kiroshi Opticals logo on the temples/arms as well as Night City-inspired symbols. The edges and temple tips glow neon yellow when the glasses are active. The black frames are translucent, which allows you to see some of the internal mechanisms and circuitry that powers Viture's high-tech extended reality glasses.

Viture launched its flagship Luma series in late August, so the Cyberpunk 2077-themed model utilizes the manufacturer's newest tech. The glasses create a private 152-inch virtual display for gaming, watching videos, and productivity. The Luma series uses Sony's latest Micro-OLED display panels and offer 1200p resolution with 120Hz refresh rate. The lenses are coated in electrochromic film to block out light and to prevent people around you from seeing your screen. The virtual display is crisp and bright whether you're outside in natural light or in a dark room.

As mentioned, the Cyber XR edition has the lightweight form factor of the Luma Pro with the more advanced tech of the Luma Ultra. The enhanced features include an increase in peak brightness from 1,000 to 1,500 nits, hand gesture support, and 6DoF (Degrees of Freedom). The tracking sensors register head and body movements, which makes the Ultra and Cyber editions better equipped for augmented reality. The Luma Pro, for reference, is limited to head movements (3DoF).

The glasses can connect to just about any device with USB-C video out, but handheld gaming is the biggest draw for many users. Viture glasses work wonderfully with Steam Deck, Asus ROG Ally, Lenovo Legion Go, and other Windows handhelds. When connected to iOS, Android, macOS, or Windows devices, you can use Viture's free Spacewalker app to create three virtual displays. This is especially helpful if you plan on using the glasses for work as well as entertainment.

Viture XR Glasses are compatible with Nintendo Switch and Switch 2, but you'll need an extra accessory to act as the Switch 1/2 Dock Set. The Viture Pro Mobile Dock is an all-in-one hub that connects to your console and the glasses. It has a built-in 13,000mAh battery that can extend the Switch's battery life by up to eight hours. The Pro Mobile Dock retail for $129, but it's still available for its $99 Black Friday price on Amazon. The promotion also includes a free $19 console mount for Switch or Switch 2. The discount shows up on the checkout screen with both items in your cart. The mounts are different, so make sure you select the right model.

Use Viture Luma Cyber XR Glasses on Switch 1/2:

  • Viture Pro Mobile Dock -- $99 ($129)
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Mount - Free with Mobile Dock
  • Nintendo Switch Mount -- Free with Mobile Dock

The Viture Luma Cyber XR Glasses come with a hardshell case with room for the detachable power cable, the Cyberpunk-branded microfiber cloth, and multiple nose pads. Multiple sets of nose pads are included. You can also bend the temple tips to find the right fit. If you have corrective vision, each lens has a myopia dial that goes to -4.0 D.

If you're interested in extended reality glasses but want to save some cash, Amazon's Black Friday deal on the Viture Luma Pro XR Glasses is still available. You can buy the Luma Pro for $424 (was $499) and get a free 8BitDo Ultimate 2C Bluetooth Controller. Amazon has also restocked its $285 deal on the Viture Pro XR Glasses. The Pro XR launched in 2024 and features a 135-inch 1080p display with 120Hz refresh rate. This deal also includes a free 8BitDo Ultimate 2C Bluetooth Controller.
